intro: Gilia effusa, commonly known as the spreading gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky areas and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are showy, with five petals that range in color from pink to purple, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Gilia effusa is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks.
